conclusion: To solve for the refractive index of the glass brick, analyze the path of light rays inside the semicircle and their refraction at the boundary.
The incident ray makes an angle θ = 30° with the normal at point O.
The angle of incidence α1 = 90° - θ = 60°.
The refracted ray will emerge from the semicircle at some angle β relative to the normal at the exit point O'.
After exiting the semicircle, light rays fall on screen CD, creating two bright spots.
The distance between the two bright spots on the screen is given as (√3 + 1)R.
According to Snell’s law: n sin(60°) = sin(30°).
We need to find the relationship between distances l1 and l2 on the screen.
The total path length in the semicircle can be divided into a straight line segment and a circular arc segment.
Using the Law of Sines, l1 + l2 = (√3 + 1)R.
The refractive index can be derived as n = sin(60°)/sin(30°).
The refractive index of the glass is √3.
